timeline.message: Added Bee Armor (and all the things to make it function)
Fixed some Wildcards (Auto formater messed with it)

timeline.bodyText: Using the PlayerMoveEvent is very risky as it can cause a ton of lag.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

replies.bodyText:
Yeah, i should have been more concernded about the performance.
I'm currently looking for an alternative to PlayerMoveEvent.
replies.author: beSn0w

timeline.bodyText: Exclusion checks like these should be at the top for performance reasons.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

replies.bodyText: A bit folish of me, will fix it.
replies.author: beSn0w

timeline.bodyText: Bees/Honey blocks have only been introduced in 1.15. Slimefun however is for 1.13, 1.14 and 1.15. So you will need to do adequate checks to make these version-exclusive...
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: Bees/Honey blocks have only been introduced in 1.15. Slimefun however is for 1.13, 1.14 and 1.15. So you will need to do adequate checks to make these version-exclusive...
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -3352,6 +3352,23 @@ public int getSpeed() {
 		new WitherAssembler(categories.electricity, SlimefunItems.WITHER_ASSEMBLER, RecipeType.ENHANCED_CRAFTING_TABLE,
 		new ItemStack[] {SlimefunItems.BLISTERING_INGOT_3, new ItemStack(Material.NETHER_STAR), SlimefunItems.BLISTERING_INGOT_3, SlimefunItems.WITHER_PROOF_OBSIDIAN, SlimefunItems.ANDROID_MEMORY_CORE, SlimefunItems.WITHER_PROOF_OBSIDIAN, SlimefunItems.ELECTRIC_MOTOR, SlimefunItems.REINFORCED_ALLOY_INGOT, SlimefunItems.CARBONADO_EDGED_CAPACITOR})

+        .register(plugin);

+        .register(plugin);

+        .register(plugin);

replies.bodyText: Fixed and tested with my latest commit.
replies.author: beSn0w

timeline.bodyText: Bees/Honey blocks have only been introduced in 1.15. Slimefun however is for 1.13, 1.14 and 1.15. So you will need to do adequate checks to make these version-exclusive...
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: You added a new research but didnt update the language files...
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: This is ran on every little movement, it can run hundreds or thousands of times a second. Doing an item lookup EACH time is gonna REALLY hurt performance. You should do a ton of checks before ANYTHING to make sure this is exactly what you want!
timeline.author: WalshyDev

timeline.bodyText: You should use the heightmaps (getHighestBlockAt, getHighestBlockYAt) which would be much more efficient.
timeline.author: WalshyDev

timeline.bodyText: Should probably just revert all this. It makes no real change but now imports are quite unorganised
timeline.author: WalshyDev

replies.bodyText: Fixed. I don't know why my auto formater even puts stuff in Wildcards, I'll have to see if i can turn that off.
replies.author: beSn0w

timeline.bodyText: Also you shouldn't ignore cancelled. There's really no point.
timeline.author: WalshyDev

timeline.message: Fixed Mincraft Version Compatibility and some IDE weirdness

timeline.bodyText: These items actually don't use any 1.15 Materials, so there isn't really much of a point in initializing them conditionally here. It's fine for these items to exist on 1.13/1.14 since you already handle that in SlimefunItemSetup
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

replies.bodyText: Good point, I'll just go ahead and replace the recipe with something else for the versions below 1.15.X
replies.author: beSn0w

replies.bodyText:
nononononononoononnoonoononono.
The way you handled it in SlimefunItemSetup was totally correct.
It's just redundant at this spot since you have already done it in SlimefunItemSetup.
Do not introduce alternate recipes because that will just be a total mess and frankly, having bee armor prior to 1.15 doesn't really make much sense anyway.
replies.author: TheBusyBiscuit

replies.bodyText: Ah, I understand. Its indeed a bit wierd to have bee themed armor in a version without bees.
replies.author: beSn0w

timeline.bodyText: Please do not use wildcard imports.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

replies.bodyText:
I thought I fixed that, I must have accidentally used the auto formater.
Fixed in my latest Commit.
replies.author: beSn0w

timeline.message: Added the research text to the researches_en Language file
Changed some stuff in BeeWingListener, Should be more performance friendly now.
Some refactoring and added a material check.

timeline.bodyText: } and else on seperate lines please.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText:
I was gonna point out the irresponsibly chosen name, should have rather been "beeArmorEnchantments".
But then I realized the above armorsets use the exact same pattern ._.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: This check is pretty redundant since the material check is one of the first lines in SlimefunUtils.isItemSimilar anyway. So this adds no real benefit to it, neither readability, efficiency nor performance.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: Wrong indentation
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: Also since we now enforce these: Nonnull please
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: @LinoxGH You can pretty much add yourself as an author here below too at this point.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: Nonnull and documentation please.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: This should rather be an int since you only decrement by whole numbers anyway
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: Not really any need for this distance variable here, it is a bit redundant. You can just return y - (the new loc y)
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.message: Refactoring, requested changes and lots of improvement.
Shhh noone needs to know about this.
